description:
This course contains detailed and complete information on one of the most important minerals to maintain our physical and mental health,” The Magnesium”.

Magnesium is an essential element to sustain life and to prevent or treat diseases such as:

Aging

Aggressive Behavior

Alcoholism

Amytrophic Lateral Sclerosis

Alzheimer's Disease

Arrhythmia

Arthrosis.

Asthma

Attention Deficit Disorder

Autism

Cancer

Cerebral Palsy

Cerebro-vascular accidents.

Chemical Sensitivity

Chronic fatigue.

Cluster Headaches

Cocaine-related Stroke

Constipation

Cramps

Chronic diarrhea.

Depression.

Diabetes

Epilepsy.

Fibromyalgia.

Fluoride Toxicity

Insomnia.

Head Injuries, Central Nervous System Injuries

Heart Disease. Heart Attack, Atherosclerosis, Cardiovascular Disease, etc.

HIV, AIDS

Hypertension

Inflammation of the prostate gland.

Irritable Colom

Kidney Stones

Symptoms of menopause

Migraine Headache

Mitral Valve Prolapse

Multiple Sclerosis

Nystagmus

Obesity.

Osteoporosis

Parkinson's disease

Peripheral vascular disease

Pregnancy-related problems, Eclampsia

Premenstrual Syndrome, PMS

Psychiatric Disorders

Radiation Protection

Repetitive Strain Injury

Rheumatoid Arthritis

Schizophrenia.

Sickle Cell Disease

SIDS

Sports-related problems

Stress

Stuttering

Tetanus

Tinnitis, Sound Sensitivity

TMJ

Toxic Shock

Violence

Etc.

The daily take Magnesium as complement for any particular disease, is equivalent to reorder the entire organism, obtaining in this way, a ¡Complete Cure!

Magnesium is an essential mineral for human nutrition.

Magnesium is needed for more than 300 biochemical reactions in the body. It helps to maintain normal nerve and muscle function, supports a healthy immune system, keeps the heart beat steady, and helps bones remain strong. It also helps regulate blood glucose levels and aid in the production of energy and protein.

Magnesium is involved in more than 300 essential metabolic reactions such as:

Energy production. Synthesis of essential molecules. Structural roles. Ion transport across cell membranes. Cell signaling. Cell migration. Nutrient interactions. Etc.

Magnesium helps prevent premature aging of body and mind.
title: Increase its Physical and Intellectual capacity
